entities.name: John J. Ray III
entities.context: John J. Ray III (born January 1959) is an American attorney and CEO who specializes in recovering funds from failed corporations.

entities.name: John J. Ray Jr.

attributes.relationship: Father of John J. Ray III

entities.context: He is the son of union plumber John J. Ray Jr. and his wife Florence.

attributes.relationship: Mother of John J. Ray III

entities.context: He is the son of union plumber John J. Ray Jr. and his wife Florence.

entities.name: Sam Bankman-Fried
entities.context: Ray was appointed to succeed Sam Bankman-Fried as the company's CEO.

entities.name: FTX
entities.context: He was appointed CEO of cryptocurrency exchange FTX in the aftermath of its November 2022 collapse.

entities.name: Enron Creditors Recovery Corp.
entities.context: He previously served as chairman of Enron Creditors Recovery Corp., a company tasked with recovering creditor funds from Enron

entities.name: Enron
entities.context: After Enron emerged from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy in 2004, Ray was appointed to chair the effort to recover assets for creditors

entities.name: Touche Ross

entities.name: Avidity Partners LLC

entities.name: Owl Hill Advisory
